['Unfed – Lacking food.', 'Undernourished – Not having enough nutrients in diet.', 'Malnourished – A severe deficiency of nutrients.', 'Starving – Extremely hungry because of lack of food.', 'Famished – Very hungry; starving.', 'Hungry stomach – Stomach feeling empty due to need for food.', 'Inadequately fed – Not receiving enough food or nutrition.', 'Underfed – Receiving less than the necessary amount of food.', 'Deprived of food – Being denied access to sufficient nourishment.', 'Nutrient-deficient – Lacking essential dietary components.', 'Fasting (when unintended) – Intentionally not eating, but here it refers to a lack that might cause hunger if continued without intention.', 'Empty belly – A colloquial term for feeling very hungry or having an empty stomach.', 'Goiter (indirectly related) – An enlarged thyroid gland which can sometimes indicate iodine deficiency, though not directly a sign of hunger.', "Vitamin deficiency – Lacking essential vitamins in one's diet that could lead to feeling hungry or weak.", 'Picky eater (can lead to hunger if not addressed) – A person who is selective about what they eat, which might result in insufficient nutrient intake and thus a sensation of hunger.', 'Food insecurity – The state of being without reliable access to a sufficient quantity of affordable, nutritious food.', 'Underfed child – A child who has not been receiving enough food for proper growth and development.', 'Unfulfilled appetite – An ongoing sensation of hunger due to insufficient feeding or eating patterns.', 'Empty pantry – No food available at home, indicating possible hunger.', 'Lean and gaunt (due to lack of food) – Physically thin and haggard-looking as a result of not having enough food; typically used to describe severe or chronic hunger.']
